thread.title: DeMarcus Cousins gets new number, grand welcome from Pelicans
thread.title_full: DeMarcus Cousins gets new number, grand welcome from Pelicans

author: Arthur Weinstein (awperform@gmail.com)
title: DeMarcus Cousins gets new number, grand welcome from Pelicans
text:
February 22, 2017 11:56am   11:56am EST Basketball, NBA, News, Sacramento Kings, English, DeMarcus Cousins, New Orleans Pelicans The Pelicans dispatched the owner's private plane to fly DeMarcus Cousins to New Orleans. DeMarcus Cousins (Getty Images) 
Updated at 11:56 a.m. ET 
Updated at 11:56 a.m. ET 
DeMarcus Cousins will have a new number when he makes his debut in a Pelicans uniform Thursday night. 
ESPN reports that Cousins has swapped his traditional No. 15 for the No. 0. Why the change? Cousins told The Undefeated in a text, "New life …" to explain the new number. 
MORE: DeMarcus Cousins overcome with emotion in farewell to Sacramento 
Cousins had already received a grand welcome to the city ahead of his official introduction Wednesday. Team owner Tom Benson dispatched his private jet — along with coach Alvin Gentry and general manager Dell Demps — to fly Cousins and fellow former King Omri Casspi, to New Orleans. 
And the team put up a "Welcome Boogie to the Big Easy" digital sign on the Smoothie King Center to make him feel at home. — New Orleans Pelicans (@PelicansNBA) February 21, 2017 
Cousins' debut with the Pelicans Thursday night at home against the Rockets (8 p.m. ET) will create plenty of media buzz. Watch This
